title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: Reliance Consumer, three Coca-Cola bottlers to invest ₹65,000 cr in food processing sector
Govt committed to bridge digital divide, boost local telecom manufacturing: Jyotiraditya Scindia
India's indigenous wheeled-APC "WhAP" to take nation's defence innovation to global stage: DRDO
FMCG giants acquire D2C players to broaden premium offerings, use digital data: Report
Submer enters India, to set up manufacturing hub for sustainable data centers
PM Modi flags off Avaada’s ₹9,200 cr green energy push with solar, storage projects in Rajasthan
ABB India invests ₹140 crore to expand LV motors facility, launches IE5 ultra-efficient motors
We aim to grow into a ₹2,500-crore company in next 5 years: Aimtron Chairman
Shree Refrigerations secures defence contracts from Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders
items.summary:
*Shree Refrigerations* won a ₹49.34 crore contract to supply HVAC systems and magnetic bearing compressors to *Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders*.
- This follows a previous order of ₹106.62 crore from *Hindustan Shipyard* and ongoing work with *Goa Shipyard Ltd*.
- The company's shares rose 7%, reflecting investor confidence in its defense and industrial project growth.

**Keywords:** defense contracts, HVAC, refrigeration, shipbuilding, India

items.title: India Signs ₹62,370 Crore Deal for 97 LCA Mk1A Jets
items.summary:
*India's Defence Ministry signed a ₹62,370 crore contract with HAL for 97 LCA Mk1A jets, including 68 fighter and 29 twin-seater variants.*
- The aircraft will feature over 64% indigenous content and advanced onboard systems, with deliveries starting in 2027-28.
- The Mk1A is intended to replace the aging MiG-21 fighters, addressing the IAF's fighter squadron shortages.*

items.title: India considers French fighter jet engines amid US delays
items.summary:
*India is exploring French-made fighter jet engines as US joint manufacturing talks slow down.* 
*India aims to build nearly 200 advanced jets to replace aging aircraft and boost domestic defense production.*
*Tensions in India-US relations have affected defense collaborations, prompting India to diversify its sources.*

items.title: India tests Agni-Prime Missile from rail-based launcher in first-ever trial
Hindustan Zinc partners Ripik.AI to introduce AI system for hotspot monitoring in smelter
Designing the future: Inside the minds of the engineers powering India’s EV journey
Avlock International India inaugurates fastener manufacturing facility in Rabale, Navi Mumbai
Jewellers urge FM Sitharaman to let SEZs manufacture for domestic market
India poised to lead global green hydrogen push, says S&P's Dave Ernsberger
Altman’s next big move: A factory to build 1GW of AI infrastructure weekly
Energy security now about minerals, storage, data, not just oil and gas: MEA official
'Make in India' transforms country into global manufacturing powerhouse: Piyush Goyal
"Everything from chip to ship...": PM Modi calls for boost to Atmanirbhar Bharat manufacturing
JSW Motors talks tech tie-up with BYD, other China car cos
India set to lead global green hydrogen push: S&P Global
Electrolyser PLI companies seek to defer launch by a year
Hindustan Aeronautics set to ink contract worth ₹66,500 crore for 97 Tejas Mark-1A fighters today
India successfully tests Agni-Prime missile from rail-based mobile launcher, Rajnath Singh confirms
India to strengthen aviation oversight as fleet expands
items.author: ET Infra Desk
items.summary:
- India is preparing *stronger aviation oversight* and more manpower as its commercial jet fleet has nearly doubled in a decade and roughly **2,000 aircraft are on order**.
- Scrutiny intensified after an *Air India* crash that killed 260 people, exposing safety concerns; the regulator reported **263 safety-related lapses** amid warnings of understaffing and pilot shortages.
- The government says the *Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau* is probing per international protocols while the Supreme Court seeks a response on calls for an independent probe, and officials note room for **more carriers** as demand grows.

items.title: India builds ecosystem for critical minerals; 34 blocks auctioned
items.author: Saurav Anand
items.summary:
- India is building an integrated ecosystem under the *National Critical Mineral Mission* to cut import dependence, having auctioned **34** critical-mineral blocks and 542 mineral blocks since 2014.
- The government is overhauling exploration—notifying *24 exploration agencies*, awarding first-ever exploration licences to 13 bidders and deploying *drone*, *AI* and remote-sensing technologies to accelerate discovery.
- India is securing overseas supplies via *KABIL* (lithium in Argentina), offering a **₹1,500 crore** recycling incentive and setting up Centres of Excellence to support the *energy transition* and *net zero 2070* goal.

items.title: Cabinet clears ₹69,725 crore package to boost shipbuilding
items.summary:
- Cabinet approved a **₹69,725 crore** *shipbuilding* package to make India a *top‑10* builder by 2030 and *top‑5* by 2047, seizing a four‑year window as production shifts from Korea/Japan.
- Key funds include SBFAS **₹24,736cr** (yard aid, recycling), Maritime Development Fund **₹25,000cr** (₹20,000cr investment fund with 49% govt equity + ₹5,000cr interest incentive) and Shipbuilding Development Scheme **₹19,989cr** (clusters, tech, credit cover).
- Reforms — infrastructure status for large ships, GST/TDS reliefs and five maritime bills — aim to cut foreign dependence, save ~**₹6 lakh crore/yr** in *forex* and create ~**2.2 million** *jobs* by 2047.

items.title: India smartphone exports up 39%; US shipments $965M
items.summary:
- *Smartphone* exports from India rose 39% YoY to **$1.53 billion** in August 2025, with shipments to the *US* doubling to **$965 million** (from $388m in Aug 2024).
- Industry body *ICEA* disputed a GTRI report, saying August declines are seasonal due to new-model launches, plant retrofitting and diversion to meet domestic festive demand.
- ICEA chairman Pankaj Mohindroo warned against oversimplifying monthly trade data and urged expert consultation before drawing conclusions.

items.title: TSMC and designers use AI to cut AI-chip energy
items.summary:
- TSMC showcased AI-powered chip-design tools developed with *Cadence* and *Synopsys* that could boost AI-chip *energy efficiency* by about **10x** through optimized *chiplet* packaging.
- The software often outperformed human engineers and ran far faster (five minutes vs two days), targeting high-power servers like *Nvidia*'s that can draw ~1,200W.
- The work aims to overcome limits of electrical data transfer and support emerging solutions like *optical interconnects* to cut data-center power long-term.

items.title: Tata Electronics seeks ASML, JT Corp partners for fab ecosystem
items.author: Dia Rekhi
items.summary:
- Tata Electronics is in talks with *ASML* and *JT Corp* to outfit its Dholera fab and an OSAT site in Assam, complementing ties with Tokyo Electron and Merck to build a local ecosystem.
- Experts say the fab likely won't need ASML's EUV machines initially; older lithography from *Canon/Nikon* or ASML's non‑EUV tools should suffice for pilot lines and nodes above 28nm.
- Supplier engagement and Assam government outreach, along with JT's strength in *burn‑in* test systems, signal accelerating localisation of semiconductor manufacturing and testing in India.

items.title: Crown Worldwide opens green-certified facility in Bengaluru
items.summary:
*Crown Worldwide Group* has inaugurated its third owned facility in India in Bengaluru, built on a green-certified design with advanced infrastructure. 

The 76,000 sq. ft. center features smart systems, future-ready services, and sustainability initiatives, including 57,000 sq. ft. of greenery and digital infrastructure. 

This milestone marks a strategic step in strengthening Crown's India footprint, supporting services like bonded warehousing, cold storage, and secure spaces for cultural assets, contributing significantly to its global revenue.

items.title: CSL signs MoUs to boost India’s shipbuilding
items.summary:
*Cochin Shipyard Limited (CSL) has signed two major MoUs to strengthen India's *shipbuilding* industry.*
- One MoU with Hyundai Heavy Industries' affiliate HD KSOE focuses on utilizing Kochi’s new dry dock and establishing a Block Fabrication Facility, investing around ₹3,700 crore and creating 2,000 jobs.
- The second MoU with Guidance Tamil Nadu aims to develop a ₹15,000 crore greenfield shipyard, potentially generating 10,000 jobs, highlighting India’s push towards *indigenisation* and *maritime self-reliance*.*

items.title: India-Morocco Defence Cooperation Boosted by New Facility
items.summary:
- *Tata Advanced Systems Limited* (TASL) inaugurated a new defence manufacturing facility in Morocco's Berrechid, enhancing *India-Morocco* ties.
- The plant, producing **armoured wheel platforms** like the *WhAP 8x8*, signifies a major *defence industry* milestone, with the first deliveries to the Moroccan Army expected soon.
- An *MoU* on defence cooperation was signed, covering *training, capacity building*, and *industrial collaboration*, strengthening the strategic partnership between the two nations.

items.title: Gem & Jewellery Industry Seeks Support Amid US Tariffs
items.summary:
*The Indian gem and jewellery sector is urging government support due to the impact of **50% US tariffs** on exports.*
- Industry representatives request domestic manufacturing permissions, loan moratoriums, and extended export deadlines to mitigate job losses and financial strains.
- Mumbai's SEEPZ, a key export hub, faces reduced orders and 40% lower capacity utilization, prompting calls for relief measures to sustain employment and sector stability.

items.title: GST 2.0: FMCG firms expect price points to return
items.summary:
*FMCG companies have temporarily reduced *price points* like ₹2, ₹5, and ₹10* after the new GST structure was implemented.*
- They expect *these prices to be restored within 2 months* as companies adapt to the change.
- *Industry leaders predict* these measures are *short-term* and that prices will normalize with increased volume growth.

items.title: L&T Semiconductors Starts Selling Products
items.summary:
*L&T Semiconductors has launched 3-4 semiconductor products, aiming for 15 by 2026, with sales starting in 2027.*
- The company designs and sells smart devices using a *fabless model* and plans to expand its design capabilities.
- They are exploring entry into the *Chinese market* and seek government support through schemes like the Design Linked Incentive scheme.

items.title: Montra Electric to unveil eHCV commercial manufacturing plant in Manesar
Xbattery raises $2.3M for battery tech innovation
items.summary:
*Xbattery*, a Hyderabad-based *deeptech startup*, secured **$2.3 million** in funding to enhance its *R&D facilities* and expand its teams. 
- The company's focus is on developing **next-generation Battery Management Systems** for *electric vehicles* and stationary uses, particularly *high-capacity systems* for electric four-wheelers.
- The startup aims to reduce India's dependency on foreign products by creating **India’s first high-voltage BMS** and plans to expand from the domestic market to Europe and North America.

items.title: MNRE Secretary hopeful of achieving 1 cr rooftop solar installations under PM Suryaghar in "quick time"
HCA Healthcare Opens Global Center in Hyderabad
items.summary:
*HCA Healthcare inaugurated its *Global Capability Center* in Hyderabad, India, with a $75 million investment.*

- The center covers over 400,000 sq ft and aims to foster *innovation* and *operational excellence*.

- The initiative will create *3,000 jobs* across sectors like IT, supply chain, HR, and finance, supporting healthcare services in the US and UK.

items.title: Reliance to Invest ₹1,156 Cr in Tamil Nadu
items.summary:
- *Reliance Consumer Products* will invest **₹1,156 crore** to establish an **integrated manufacturing facility** at SIPCOT Allikulam Industrial Park, Tamil Nadu.
- The **60-acre** plant aims to produce a variety of FMCG products, creating **2,000 jobs** over five years.
- This investment enhances Tamil Nadu's status as a **key hub** for industrial growth, alongside major investments in shipbuilding by Cochin Shipyard and Mazagon Dock, generating a total of **55,000 jobs**.

items.title: US tariffs cloud India's manufacturing ambitions: WEF
items.summary:
*India's manufacturing growth faces significant challenges due to US tariffs, including a 50% penalty on imports.*
- The World Economic Forum reports that *US tariffs impact India’s manufacturing and labor sectors*, adding regional economic pressure.
- The overall outlook indicates *global economic weakening in 2026, heightened trade disruptions, and divergence between advanced and emerging markets.*

items.title: Poly Medicure to fully acquire Citieffe Group
items.summary:
*Poly Medicure* is acquiring Italy's *Citieffe Group* for ₹324 crore, including subsidiaries in the US and Mexico. 
- This move gives Poly Medicure access to the *global orthopaedics market*, especially in trauma and extremities. 
- The company plans to leverage Citieffe's R&D and expand its international footprint, potentially manufacturing products in India for cost reduction.

items.title: Dubai's Indian Jewellery Importer Cuts Volumes 30%
items.summary:
- *Bafleh Jewellery*, a major Middle East importer, is shifting to **lightweight** and **lower-karat gold** designs due to soaring bullion prices.
- Despite increased *import values*, *volumes* dropped by **20-30%** as gold prices surged from around $2,200‑$2,500 to $3,600 per ounce.
- The company remains confident in India's *handmade jewellery* dominance, emphasizing its *craftsmanship*, despite market challenges and price volatility.

items.title: SDHI partners with Royal IHC for offshore vessels in India
items.summary:
*Swan Defence and Heavy Industries (SDHI)* signed an MoU with *Royal IHC*, a Dutch offshore vessel specialist, to collaborate on designing, building, and retrofitting *offshore vessels* in India. 
- The partnership leverages *SDHI's* large dry dock and Indian shipyard to enhance *indigenous shipbuilding* and support *Make in India* initiatives. 
- This strategic alliance positions India as a competitive player in the global *shipbuilding industry*, especially in offshore oil, gas, and renewable energy sectors.

items.title: Scan Global Logistics enters Indian market
items.summary:
*Scan Global Logistics (SGL)* officially entered India, opening bases in Mumbai, Chennai, and Delhi, with plans to expand to 15-20 offices nationwide within three years. 

- The company emphasizes *customer-centricity*, aiming to deliver **reliable, adaptable** logistics solutions tailored to India’s diverse markets.

- With a focus on *long-term value* over price competition, SGL targets large SMEs and sees India as a land of **vast opportunities** aligned with their *Vision 2027* growth roadmap.

items.title: INST researchers develop nanomaterial that stimulates brain cells without surgery
items.summary:
- Scientists at the *Institute of Nano Science and Technology* created a **nanomaterial** called *graphitic carbon nitride* (g-C₃N₄) that can communicate with neurons naturally.
- This material stimulates brain cells without invasive surgery, potentially aiding in treatments for *neurodegenerative diseases* like Parkinson's and Alzheimer's.
- The discovery opens avenues for *non-invasive therapies* and innovative *brain-with-computing* technologies, though further studies are needed for human application.

items.title: Adani Cement passes full GST cut to customers
items.summary:
*Adani Cement will transfer the entire 10% GST reduction from 28% to 18% directly to customers, aiming to lower construction costs.*
- The move supports *housing affordability*, infrastructure growth, and benefits the entire construction supply chain.
- *Industry leaders* see this as a step toward *empowering MSMEs, creating jobs*, and fostering *long-term demand and innovation* in India's construction sector.
